bearerAuth.description: Bearer token authentication. Pass the token configured via --api-token or AETHER_API_TOKEN.

info.description:
Backend API service for the **Aether WebUI**. This service manages Aether 5G deployments including SD-Core components, gNBs (srsRAN, OCUDU), Kubernetes clusters, and host systems.

## Base URL

All API endpoints are served under `/api/v1/`.

## Authentication

When token authentication is enabled (`--api-token` flag or `AETHER_API_TOKEN` env var), all `/api/*` endpoints require a bearer token:

```
Authorization: Bearer <token>
```

The following paths are always public: `/healthz`, `/openapi.json`, `/docs`, and frontend static files.

## Providers

The API is organized into **providers**  modular units that each register a set of endpoints:

| Provider | Prefix | Description |
|----------|--------|-------------|
| meta | `/api/v1/meta/` | Server introspection  version, build info, runtime, config, provider status, store health |

## Response Format

All endpoints return JSON. Error responses follow the [RFC 9457](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc9457) Problem Details format.
info.title: Aether WebUI API

get.description: Returns the Go toolchain version, target OS, and architecture used to compile the server binary.
Returns non-secret configuration values including listen address, storage paths, feature flags, and schema version.
Returns the name, enabled/running state, and endpoint count for each registered provider.
Returns the server's PID, running user/group, binary path, start time, and uptime.
Returns store engine, path, file size, schema version, and live diagnostic results (ping, write, read, delete).
Returns the server's version string, build date, git branch, and commit hash. Useful for diagnostics, compatibility checks, and deployment verification.
Returns all managed cluster nodes with role assignments.

post.description: Creates a new node with optional roles and credentials.

delete.description: Deletes a node and its role assignments.

get.description: Returns a single node with secret-presence flags.

put.description: Partial update  merges non-nil fields; roles replaces entire set when provided.

get.description: Returns all available OnRamp components and their actions.
Returns a single OnRamp component by name.

post.description: Runs a make target for the specified component and action.

get.description: Reads vars/main.yml and returns the parsed configuration.

patch.description: Merges the provided fields into vars/main.yml, preserving untouched values.

get.description: Lists available vars profiles (main-*.yml files).
Reads a specific vars profile and returns its configuration.

post.description: Copies the named profile to vars/main.yml, making it active.

get.description: Parses the current hosts.ini and returns structured inventory data.

post.description: Generates hosts.ini from managed nodes in the database and writes it to disk.

get.description: Returns clone status, current commit, branch, tag, and dirty state of the OnRamp repository.

post.description: Clones the repo if missing, checks out the pinned version, and validates the directory.

get.description: Returns recent make target executions and their status.
Returns details and output for a specific task.

parameters.description: Byte offset for incremental output reads
parameters.name: offset

schema.description: Byte offset for incremental output reads

get.description: Returns CPU model, core counts, frequency, cache, and flags.
Returns partition list with usage details.
Returns physical and swap memory usage.
Returns time-series metric data with optional time range, label filtering, and aggregation.
Returns DNS servers and search domains from resolv.conf.
Returns network interface details including addresses, MAC, MTU, and flags.
Returns TCP/UDP ports in LISTEN state with process info.
Returns hostname, OS, platform, kernel version, arch, and uptime.
